sn47.32:1.1: “Mendicants, these four kinds of mindfulness meditation, when developed and cultivated, lead solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
sn47.32:2.2: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.32:2.3: They meditate observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.32:2.5: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.32:2.6: These four kinds of mindfulness meditation, when developed and cultivated, lead solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.”
